text: Love Is Everything is a 1965 studio album by Johnny Mathis. It was released on 5 March, 1965 through Mercury Records and included covers of hit songs from the 1930s, 1940s, 1950s and 1960s. It went to number 11 in the United States. ==Track listing== ===Side one=== #"Never Let Me Go" from The Scarlet Hour (Jay Livingston, Ray Evans) – 2:31 #"People" from Funny Girl (Bob Merrill, Jule Styne) – 3:08 #"A Thousand Blue Bubbles" (Bart Howard, Carlo Rossi) – 2:40 #"Love Is Everything" (Edward Pola, George Wyle) – 2:56 #"Young and Foolish" from Plain and Fancy (Albert Hague, Arnold Horwitt) – 3:40 #"An Affair to Remember (Our Love Affair)" from An Affair to Remember (Harold Adamson, Leo McCarey, Harry Warren) – 2:42 ===Side two=== #"Come Ride the Wind with Me" (Alfred Bartles, Bryan Lindsay) – 3:01 #"Go Away Little Girl" (Gerry Goffin, Carole King) – 3:19 #"Dancing in the Dark" from The Band Wagon (Arthur Schwartz, Howard Dietz) – 2:52 #"Long Ago (and Far Away)" from Cover Girl (Jerome Kern, Ira Gershwin) – 3:42 #"This Is All I Ask" (Gordon Jenkins) – 4:04 #"One More Mountain" (Eddie Snyder, Paul Vance) – 2:24 ==References== Category:1965 albums Category:Johnny Mathis albums Category:Mercury Records albums
title: Love Is Everything (Johnny Mathis album)
